criticism: The migrate function allows attackers to migrate tokens arbitrarily from an arbitrary user to a caller, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The transfer function allows attackers to transfer tokens arbitrarily from an arbitrary user to a caller, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The transferFrom function allows attackers to transfer tokens arbitrarily from an arbitrary user to a caller, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The approve function allows attackers to approve arbitrary transfers from an arbitrary user to a caller, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The setMigrationAgent function allows attackers to set arbitrary migration agents, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The setExchangeRate function allows attackers to set arbitrary exchange rates, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The setICORunning function allows attackers to start or stop the ICO, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The setTransfer function allows attackers to enable or disable token transfers, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The addInitialInvestor function allows attackers to add arbitrary initial investors, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The addToken function allows attackers to add arbitrary tokens to an arbitrary address, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The setEarlyInvestorExchangeRate function allows attackers to set arbitrary early investor exchange rates, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The setStartDate function allows attackers to set arbitrary start dates for the ICO, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The setStartRefund function allows attackers to start or stop the refund process, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The finalize function allows attackers to finalize the ICO and add arbitrary tokens to the contract, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
The refund function allows attackers to refund arbitrary amounts of tokens, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.
